intro: Collomia heterophylla, commonly known as the Sierra starflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Collomia heterophylla is part of the Montiaceae family and is known for its adaptability to harsh, alpine environments.
